file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 05-20-99-06 - CENTER FUSELAGE II - PASSENGER CABIN TOP - EXTERNAL - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CENTER FUSELAGE II - PASSENGER CABIN TOP - EXTERNAL - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the visual inspection of center fuselage II - passenger cabin top for general condition. B. Related Zones: 243/244. C. (Applicable to EMB-145 (ALL) models) Zone Boundaries: STA X = 7131.0 thru STA X = 11990.0. (Applicable to EMB-135 (ALL) models) Zone Boundaries: STA X = 7131.0 thru STA X = 9984.0. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY CENTER FUSELAGE II - PASSENGER ALL 05-20-99-200-801-A ♦ CABIN TOP - EXTERNAL GENERAL VISU- AL INSPECTION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 05-20-99 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 05-20-99-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. CENTER FUSELAGE II - PASSENGER CABIN TOP - EXTERNAL GENERAL VISUAL INSPECTION A. General (1) This task gives instructions to do SMRD Zonal Task 53-Z243-213-003-A00. (2) You must do the external general visual inspection (GVI) of center fuselage II, at zones 243/244, within a touching distance of the items examined. (3) The function of the external general visual inspection (GVI) is to find damage, failure, or irregular conditions that can be easily seen. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 12-22-00-600-801-A/300 LIGHT DIRT - SERVICING AMM TASK 12-22-00-600-802-A/300 HEAVY DIRT - SERVICING C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Standard Ladder To get access to the inspection area E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Center fuselage II - passenger cabin top I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Put the ladder in position. (2) If necessary, clean the inspection area (AMM TASK 12-22-00-600-801-A/300) or (AMM TASK 12-22-00-600-802-A/300) as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-20-99 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. External General Visual Inspection (Figure 601) SUBTASK 212-002-A (1) Examine the fuselage zone for loose rivets, nicks, cracks, dents, erosion, corrosion, painting bad condition, skin deformation, sealant poor condition, scratches, gouges, creases, and deteriorated protective treatment. (2) Examine the fuselage skin panel at stringers and frames/bulkheads, and splices for loose rivets, nicks, cracks, dents, erosion, corrosion, and deteriorated protective treatment (Figure 601). (3) Examine the fuselage skin longitudinal and circumferential splices for loose rivets, nicks, cracks, dents, erosion, corrosion, and deteriorated protective treatment (Figure 601). (4) NOTE: Some aircraft can have TDR MODE-S TOP and LSS (Optional) installed at zones 243/244. Examine the VHF1 antenna, for loose screws and washers, nicks, cracks, dents, scratches, gouges, erosion, corrosion, flaking paint and aerodynamic sealing condition (Figure 601). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the ladder. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-20-99 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
